intro: Crotalaria eriosemoides, commonly known as the hairy crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or orange flowers in clusters. Its distinctive feature is the presence of hairy structures on the stems and leaves, giving it its common name. Crotalaria eriosemoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
